meanings.sent1: Passengers enplane the aircraft before takeoff.
meanings.sent2: We enplane at the gate and find our seats.
meanings.sent3: The excited travelers enplane the plane with big smiles.
meanings.sent4: As we enplane, we leave our worries on the ground below.
meanings.sent5: Enplaning for the first time can be a thrilling experience.

meanings.definition: To put or load onto an airplane.
meanings.sent1: The ground crew enplanes the luggage onto the plane.
meanings.sent2: Workers enplane the cargo carefully for the flight.
meanings.sent3: The team enplanes the supplies efficiently for the journey.
meanings.sent4: They enplane the equipment swiftly, ensuring a quick departure.
meanings.sent5: Enplaning the goods requires precision and coordination.
